prefix: Approach the following multiple choice question the way a doctor would.
problem_prompt:
Approach the following multiple choice question the way a doctor would. A patient present with lower gastrointestinal bleed. Sigmoidoscopy shows ulcers inthe sigmoid. Biopsy from this area shows flask-shaped ulcers. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment -
1: Intravenous ceftriaxone
2: Intravenous metronidazole
3: Intravenous steroids and sulphasalazine
4: Hydrocoisone enemas
gpt_response:
As a doctor, when presented with a patient with lower gastrointestinal bleed, sigmoidoscopy findings of ulcers in the sigmoid, and biopsy findings of flask-shaped ulcers, the most appropriate treatment would be option 3: Intravenous steroids and sulphasalazine. 

This combination therapy is commonly used to treat inflammatory bowel disease, which can cause ulcers in the gastrointestinal tract. Steroids help reduce inflammation and sulphasalazine is a medication that works as an anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive agent.

Options 1 and 2 (Intravenous ceftriaxone and metronidazole) are antibiotics and would not be appropriate for treating ulcerative colitis. Option 4 (Hydrocortisone enemas) may help with symptoms but may not address the underlying cause of the ulcers in the sigmoid.
